metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7202 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
stream_engine.cpp in libzmq (aka ZeroMQ/C++)) 4.0.5 before 4.0.5 allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct downgrade attacks via a crafted connection request. Matthew Hawn discovered that ZeroMQ did not properly validate the security handshake. A remote attacker could conduct a downgrade attack via a crafted connection request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzmq5 - 4.0.5+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zeromq3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.5+dfsg-2').
